As long as not telling them is mostly YOUR decision. My now ex-husband didnâ€™t want his family and friends to know I was trans. He asked me to basically hide or delete all my pre-transition photos on social media when we got serious. I hated to do so but I loved him. 

It created SUCH a gulf between me and literally everyone I met through him and with him. It made me anxious. We fought every time a friend or family member of his would be our houseguest. It wasnâ€™t until couplesâ€™ therapy that I realized it was because my home couldnâ€™t be my sanctuary if people didnâ€™t know that I was trans. So we had a rule that he would have to tell anyone he invited to stay with us. 

Even now that weâ€™ve split, there are STILL people, who have known me for years, who just assume Iâ€™m a cis woman. It might sound like a great thing, but I canâ€™t open up or even relax around people like that, so I avoid them, and thatâ€™s incredibly isolating at times.

My sister (4 years my senior) is much worse, which is why I donâ€™t even speak with her. 

I began HRT at 29, just a couple months before my 30th birthday. She was well aware, but still mailed me a â€˜Happy Birthday Little Brotherâ€™ card. 

Fast forward three years, and she misgendered me during dinner with my boyfriend (who became my husband) at the time. Iâ€™d warned him before we got out of the car. I told him she would misgender me, and that I wouldnâ€™t correct her because of her proclivity for drama.

I believe in creating my own family, and Iâ€™ve done so over the years with some incredible friends.
